commText: So that's all we have from this one. Kohli was superb with the bat and took the Player of the Match award, but don't forget the spell from Harpreet Brar either, finishing with figures of 2/13. No mystery balls, no darts, just the ability to beat batters in length with smart bowling. Hope you enjoyed our coverage. This is Sagar Chawla signing off on behalf of Praveen Kumar, Akshay Maanay and Abhinand Raghavendran. Goodbye!

This match could've turned out different had Punjab taken their chances. Kohli was dropped on 0, then again on 33, and went on to make a superb 77. His aggressive approach stood out tonight. Wasn't just content to play anchor and went after all the bowlers, right from Rabada to Brar with different rates of success. Rode his luck as well on a few occasions, and it was needed on a pitch that had patchy grass with the ball not quite coming on as batters are used to at Chinnaswamy. AB de Villiers, in the mid-innings show for the host broadcaster, said it was it was like the early season wickets they get for practice games.

Kohli, POTM: It's been going on for years (love story with fans at Chinnaswamy). People talk about a lot of other things when you play sport - achievement, stats, numbers. But when you look back it's the memories you create. Rahul bhai in the change room says the same nowadays. When you play, play your heart out because you're going to miss these times. The love, appreciation and backing I've received has been amazing. I try to give the team a blazing start, but if wickets fall, you have to understand the conditions as well. Wasn't the usual placid pitch. It was a bit two-paced. And I thought I need to play correct cricketing shots. Playing across the line wasn't working. Disappointed I couldn't finish the game. Was in the slot but sliced it to deep point. Not a bad start - playing after two months and getting into the tournament. They know I play the cover drive well, so they're not going to allow me to hit gaps. With guys like KG and Arshdeep hitting length, you have to create some momentum with the ball. Once you're closer to the ball, you negate the bounce and meet it earlier. You have to come up with a game plan here and there. I know my name is now attached to just promoting the game in different parts of the world when it comes to T20 cricket. But I've still got it I guess. We were not in the country (talking about his break). We were in a place where people were not recognising us. Just time together as a family, just to feel normal for two months - for me, my family - it was a surreal experience. Of course having two kids, things become totally different from a family perspective. Just the ability to be together, the connections you make with your older child. Couldn't have been more grateful to God for the opportunity to spend time with the family. It's an amazing experience to just be another person on the road and not be recognised. That's the promise I can give here - I'll keep turning up and keep trying me best.

Faf, RCB captain: On the outside (yes), not as much on the inside (was he calm?). Early in the competition you want to make sure you get over the line. Felt we were in the position to do that sooner. But great to see the guys with the composure at the back end. And the old horse DK. No I didn't feel the game was gone. With the new rule, there's an extra batter. We knew we had Mahipal coming in - has lot of power. Now with the extra batter you feel like even 14-15 rpo is gettable. Even 30 off 2 overs becomes a reality. Really pleased for him (DK). I said it the other night - really important for him to get his IPL going with confidence. That sets you up for the rest of the tournament. We need him with his experience. There's obviously a plan - from the auction - to find some sort of DNA that would work at home. It is a tough place to find out what the DNA is. It is a unique ground. Even tonight the pitch was a bit different in the sense that it wasn't a fast and bouncy pitch, and a flat pitch. Virat was important in the way he tempoed his innings. Wasn't a pitch where you could hit through the line. Good to see him, he's always smiling and enjoying himself. Still very passionate about playing cricket. Obviously had a nice break now which is very important. He's still enjoying himself, very passionate about playing cricket. Fresh and motivated to do well.
Stats from Roshan Gede
Dinesh Karthik vs LA Fast in the IPL since 2019 Runs: 309 Balls: 147 Dismissals: 6 Avg: 51.50 SR: 210.20 4s/6s: 31/19
Dinesh Karthik vs Sam Curran in the IPL Runs: 65 Balls: 25 Dismissals: 1 SR: 260 4s/6s: 8/3

Most runs in death overs (17-20) in the IPL since 2022 383 - Shimron Hetmyer (SR: 197.42) 372 - Dinesh Karthik (SR: 203.27) 351 - Rinku Singh (SR: 195) 290 - Tim David (207.14) 285 - David Miller (161.01)
PBKS bowling today \nRabada and Brar: 4/36 from 8 overs (ER: 4.5) \nOthers: 2/131 from 11.2 overs (ER: 11.56)

Most economical 4-over spells by a spinner at Chinnaswamy (IPL) 4/9 - Samuel Badree (RCB) vs MI, 2017 2/13 - Harpreet Brar (PBKS) vs RCB, 2024 1/13 - Shahbaz Nadeem (DC) vs RCB, 2017 1/14 - Daniel Vettori (RCB) vs PBKS, 2011

Dinesh Karthik: Little bit (dusting off the rustiness). I wasn't completely in control but getting there. We needed that (knock from Lomror), Anuj batted well last time but when Mahipal walked out.. he took the pressure off me. He (Harshal) is a wily customer, he has the dipping slower one and if you missed that you are a goner, I had to wait to play the scoop. I didn't say anything, he (Lomror) was calm and when he hit that six, I just told him to keep a still head. If I start bowling then you can know what the situation would be for RCB.

Shikhar Dhawan: It was a good game, we brought the game back and again we lost it. We scored 10-15 runs less, in the first six overs I played a bit slow. Those 10-15 runs cost us and the dropped catch as well. (Turning point) Virat scored 70-odd runs and we dropped a catch of the class player, we paid the price. If we had taken that catch, the momentum would have come from the second ball. But we lost the momentum over there and then we paid the price for that. It looked good but it wasn't a very true wicket, it was stopping, bit of double bounce and turned as well. 70% coming good, 30% it was doing a bit. I am happy with my runs but I thought I could have played a bit more fast in the first six overs, that's the only thing I felt. We lost wickets as well, we lost two wickets continuously and that put pressure on us. At the end, that's the total we thought on this wicket. The match went till the last over, at the end also we could have bowled a bit better. (On Harpreet Brar) He's bowling really well, especially bowling against left-handers, tremendous the way he soaked in the pressure and got us the breakthroughs. It's a very big thing in Punjab, the Kabaddi thing, the people really connect with that thigh-five, happy to see him do it.

23:15 Local Time, 17:45 GMT, 23:15 IST: Rabada quickly goes up to Arshdeep and offers some words of consolation. It's been another cracking game that's gone down to the final over, but unlike the three before, here the chasing team has got the job done. After a few hiccups through the middle overs, Karthik and Lomror were able to power RCB to victory with a blistering finish. The match was right in the balance after Harpreet Brar's superb spell as he finished with stunning figures of 2/13. Then in the 16th over, Harshal got rid of Kohli for 77, and Punjab might have fancied themselves at that point. But in walked impact sub Mahipal Lomror, struck a boundary first ball, and then launched one into the crowd off Arshdeep to get the fans pumped. Karthik then took over, smashing 28 off 10 balls to finish it with four balls to spare.

Arshdeep Singh to Karthik, FOUR, Karthik finishes it off and the crowd erupts once more! Full in the slot around off stump, he clears the front leg and hammers it straight back past the bowler. RCB have bounced back from their opening day defeat to win their first home game
Arshdeep Singh to Karthik, wide, now Arshdeep goes for a wide yorker but fails to keep it within the marker. Karthik is unable to reach it. Umpire calls wide

Arshdeep Singh to Karthik, SIX, six off the first ball, and the roof is about to come down! Back of a length outside off, Karthik premeditates, walks across the stumps and scoops it all the way over short fine. RCB players are on their feet in the dressing room
Chinnaswamy is rocking. RCB need 10 off the final over, and Arshdeep has the ball
Harshal Patel to Karthik, 1 run, goes for the yorker on middle and leg, ends up as a low full toss and Karthik drives to long-on. Wasn't able to get under it
Harshal Patel to Karthik, SIX, slower short ball down leg, wrong line from Harshal and it disappears! Karthik swivels across and pulls it nicely. It goes sailing over the fine leg boundary

Harshal Patel to Karthik, no run, Karthik is thudded on the pad by a low full toss. Harshal appeals for LBW, but the umpire turns it down. Seemed like it was missing leg stump with the angle. Another on-pace delivery from Harshal and Karthik was late on it

Harshal Patel to Karthik, FOUR, that's more like it from Karthik! Length ball on off, 136kph, Karthik swings hard and gets it straight back down the ground. Wasn't quite off the middle, but it was straight enough to get to the boundary

Harshal Patel to Karthik, no run, oh that's such a tentative poke from Karthik. Not sure what he was trying to do here. 140kph length ball just outside off, he's caught in the crease and timidly pokes at it, only to get beaten on the edge. Maybe was expecting the slower one and Harshal outfoxed him
Harshal Patel to Karthik, wide, 141.5kph, full ball straying down leg, Karthik misses and it's called a wide
Harshal Patel to Lomror, 1 run, goes for the yorker, doesn't quite nail it but it's full enough to prevent Lomror from getting under it. He drives along the ground to long-off
Harshal Patel [3.0-0-32-1] is back into the attack
That over has lifted the spirits of the crowd. RCB need 23 off 12. Harshal to bowl the penultimate one, and Lomror on strike

Arshdeep Singh to Lomror, 1 run, Arshdeep gets away with this. Could've so easily raced away for four. Low full toss on the pads, Lomror flicks nicely but it goes straight to the fielder at square leg who was brought inside the ring
Arshdeep Singh to Lomror, no run, full outside off, line is wide enough from Arshdeep to take out of Lomror's hitting arc. He swings and misses!
Fine leg goes back now. Square leg brought into the ring

Arshdeep Singh to Lomror, FOUR, doesn't quite get hold of this one, but it'll do! Crowd erupts again. Short ball onto the body, gets slightly big on Lomror as he goes for the pull but it loops over short fine

Arshdeep Singh to Lomror, SIX, oh this has been launched down the ground! Massive strike from Lomror and the crowd finds its voice again. Full delivery on middle, right in the slot for Lomror who clears the front leg and whacks it over long-on. 92-meter hit that disappears into the crowd
Arshdeep Singh to Karthik, 1 run, sharp bouncer at the head, takes Karthik by surprise and he miscues the pulll in the air. It falls short of deep midwicket
Arshdeep Singh to Lomror, byes, 1 run, slower bouncer outside off, deceives Lomror who is through the pull early. But the keeper fumbles and they get a bye
Arshdeep Singh [2.0-0-17-0] is back into the attack
Arshdeep Singh is brought back and he'll likely bowl the 18th and 20th overs. Here he is.
Sam Curran to Karthik, 2 runs, slower ball down leg as he falls for the dummy from Karthik who backed away initially before going to his stance. He glances it fine again, but this time it's cut off

Sam Curran to Karthik, FOUR, oh this is poor from Curran! First that half-volley to Lomror, and now a gentle slower ball down the leg-side to DK. It's an off-cutter around the hip, and Karthik glances it fine to the boundary
Sam Curran to Lomror, 1 run, 133kph length ball just outside off, Lomror gets forward and defends to point. A misfield from Harpreet Bhatia - the sub fielder - gives him a single
Sam Curran to Lomror, FOUR, boundary off the first ball from Lomror! It's a gift from Curran as he dishes out a half-volley on the pads, and Lomror flicks it nicely past short fine leg
Mahipal Lomror, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Lomror, the impact sub, walks out to the middle.

Sam Curran to Anuj Rawat, out Lbw!! The finger goes up and there's pin drop silence. Rawat goes for the review. Slower ball floated up on middle, he plays across the line but misses. Is it missing leg stump with the angle? Tense wait for the players out there, and the many thousands of fans. Here it is.. umpire's call. Ball-tracking shows that it would've clipped leg stump. Anuj Rawat lbw b Sam Curran 11(14) [4s-1]
Sam Curran to Anuj Rawat, THATS OUT!! Lbw!!

The finger goes up and there's pin drop silence. Rawat goes for the review. Slower ball floated up on middle, he plays across the line but misses. Is it missing leg stump with the angle? Tense wait for the players out there, and the many thousands of fans. Here it is.. umpire's call. Ball-tracking shows that it would've clipped leg stump.
Sam Curran to Anuj Rawat, no run, 127kph, full ball on off, Rawat gets forward and defends
Sam Curran [2.0-0-19-0] is back into the attack
Dinesh Karthik, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Timeout! He went for a couple of boundaries early in the over, but Harshal more than made up with the big wicket of Kohli. Now it's up to Rawat, Karthik and the rest. We're in for another thriller.

Harshal Patel to Kohli, out Caught by Harpreet Brar!! Kohli sinks in agony and there's disbelief writ large on faces of spectators. The volume has been turned off at Chinnaswamy. Full delivery outside off, Kohli opens the face and deliberately slices it in the air. But it's straight to Brar at deep backward point. Maybe the idea was to go a lot finer - over short third. But the execution goes wrong, and Kohli has to depart after making 77. Kohli c Harpreet Brar b Harshal Patel 77(49) [4s-11 6s-2]
Harshal Patel to Kohli, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
Harshal Patel to Kohli, 2 runs, yorker on off, 137.3kph, Kohli squeezes it through the square leg region and gets back easily for two
Harshal Patel to Kohli, wide, bouncer outside off, Kohli lets it go as it's way too wide
Third and fine leg are both in the ring.
Harshal Patel to Kohli, no run, 128kph, slower short ball outside off, Kohli goes for an upper-cut but is beaten
Crowd getting into it. Chants of "Kohli, Kohli"
Harpreet Brar vs RCB in the IPL Matches: 6 Wickets: 8 Avg: 19.87 SR: 16.2 ER: 7.33 BBI: 3/19 Batters dismissed: Glenn Maxwell (4 times), Virat Kohli (twice), AB de Villiers, Rajat Patidar

Harshal Patel to Kohli, FOUR, majestic from Kohli! Short of length outside off, he stands tall and slaps it hard through extra cover. He struck it so hard that it almost left a vapour trail on its way to the boundary
Harshal Patel to Kohli, FOUR, awful delivery. Full toss down leg, and Kohli swipes it past short fine for an easy boundary
Harshal Patel to Anuj Rawat, 1 run, length ball across off, Rawat hangs back and steers it to deep third
Harshal Patel [2.0-0-20-0] is back into the attack
So RCB need close to 12 an over in the last five

Harpreet Brar to Anuj Rawat, 1 run, length ball on off, Rawat sweeps along the ground to deep midwicket. Just a single. Another brilliant over from Brar who finishes his spell with figures of 2/13. No mystery balls, no darts, just pure guile

Harpreet Brar to Kohli, leg byes, 1 run, drifting down leg, Kohli looks to sweep but is hit on the pad. Gets a single to short fine. Kohli is talking to the umpire, probably not happy about the call of leg-bye. Might've got some glove
Harpreet Brar to Kohli, 2 runs, drifting into the pads, Kohli works it into the gap from midwicket and charges back for the second run. This is his bread and butter
Rabada vs RCB in the IPL Matches: 8 Wickets: 18 Avg: 12.5 SR: 10.6 ER: 7.03 BBI: 4/21
Harpreet Brar to Anuj Rawat, 1 run, superb from Brar who is predicting every move from Rawat. Pulls the length back as Rawat advances and he can only knock it to long-on for a single

Harpreet Brar to Anuj Rawat, no run, Brar is confident about an LBW appeal. He gestures animatedly and Dhawan has to oblige. Has it pitched outside the line - that's the main question. Flat length ball fired in from round the wicket, Rawat looks to sweep but misses. Gets hit on the back leg. Ball-tracking coming up, and there's a big roar from the crowd as it's pitching outside leg.
Harpreet Brar to Anuj Rawat, no run, flat length ball on off, Rawat punches it back to Brar

Highlights (Overs 7-14) - 63/2 -- Back-to-back tidy overs from Harpreet & Harshal -- 16 runs off Chahar's 1st over -- 31-ball half-century for Kohli -- Brar cleans up Patidar for 18 and breaks the 43-run stand -- 15 runs off Harshal's 2nd over -- Maxwell falls to Brar again -- Rabada finishes with 4-0-23-2

Rabada to Kohli, no run, Kohli screams in frustration after failing to get bat on this! He was outfoxed by Rabada here. He backs away slightly, Rabada follows him with a sharp delivery that skids through from short of length, cramping him for room. Kohli still tries to dab it past the keeper but is beaten
Rabada to Anuj Rawat, 1 run, back of a length delivery just outside off, Rawat cuts to deep point
Rabada to Anuj Rawat, no run, length ball on off, Rawat steers it to backward point
Rabada to Kohli, 1 run, Kohli advances down, gets a bouncer over the head but still goes after it. Mistimes the pull to deep midwicket
Rabada to Anuj Rawat, 1 run, 136kph, fuller than a length just outside off, Rawat gets forward, opens the face and guides it to deep third
Rabada to Anuj Rawat, FOUR, not a great start to his final over from Rabada! Back of a length down leg, strays in line and Rawat glances it away quite fine. Beats the fielder at fine leg
Kagiso Rabada [3.0-0-16-2] is back into the attack
Rabada to bowl out his overs
Harpreet Brar to Kohli, no run, 91.7kph, full ball drifting down leg, Kohli looks to flick but is hit on the pad. 2/9 for Brar in three overs. Remarkable stuff!
Harpreet Brar to Anuj Rawat, 1 run, works it off the pads behind square
Maxwell vs Brar in the IPL Runs: 18 Balls: 17 Dismissals: 4 Avg: 4.5 SR: 105.88

Harpreet Brar to Anuj Rawat, no run, almost another chop-on! Tossed up just outside off, it's on the fuller side but Rawat still goes back to cut. He gets a thick under-edge that bounces past leg stump
Harpreet Brar to Kohli, 1 run, 93.3kph, flat length ball on off, Kohli punches off the back foot to long-on
Harpreet Brar to Anuj Rawat, 1 run, length ball sliding away outside off, Rawat cuts it to deep point
Anuj Rawat, left handed bat, comes to the crease

Harpreet Brar to Maxwell, out Bowled!! Harpreet Brar, you beauty! This is the fourth time he's got rid of Maxwell in just 20-odd balls in IPL. Certainly has the wood over the destructive batter, and he's done it again. Flat length ball on off stump, Maxwell makes room to slap it through the off-side. All he does is chop it onto the stumps off a thick under-edge. What a spell he's bowling! Maxwell b Harpreet Brar 3(5)
Harpreet Brar to Maxwell, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!
Harshal Patel to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli steps out and slaps it hard down the ground! Short of length outside off, slower one from Harshal and Kohli absolutely nails the flat-batted smash over mid-off
Harshal Patel to Maxwell, 1 run, 140.1kph, full on the pads, Maxwell flicks to deep square leg
Harshal Patel to Maxwell, wide, slower bouncer from Harshal, and it loops over Maxwell's head, called wide
Harshal Patel to Kohli, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Kohli swats it to long-on
Harshal Patel to Maxwell, 1 run, back of a length on off, steered to deep third

Harshal Patel to Kohli, 1 run, again Kohli is rushed by this short ball and he miscues it in the air! It falls safely in front of long-on. He was on the charge and Harshal surprised him by banging it in short again. The ball got big on him as he went for the pull and struck him high on the bat. Luck is with Kohli tonight

Harshal Patel to Kohli, SIX, oh he could've been in trouble on a bigger ground. Short at the body, Kohli seems to be rushed for pace on the pull shot but manages to get it over the fielder's reach at deep square leg. 65-meter six!
Harshal Patel [1.0-0-5-0] is back into the attack
Maxwell vs Brar in the IPL (before today) Runs: 17 Balls: 14 Dismissals: 3 Avg: 5.67 SR: 121.42
Harpreet Brar to Maxwell, no run, 92.3kph, full ball drifting into the pads, Maxwell nudges it into the on-side
Harpreet Brar to Kohli, 1 run, drifting in on middle and leg, Kohli works it through square leg
Harpreet Brar to Maxwell, 1 run, tossed up around off, Maxwell opens the face and knocks it through point
Glenn Maxwell, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Harpreet Brar to Rajat Patidar, out Bowled!! Wild slog from Patidar, and he's been cleaned up! Brar provides the breakthrough for Punjab! He keeps it flat and straight, slides in off a good length, and goes past the inside edge as Patidar looks to whack it through midwicket. The ball crashes into middle. Rajat Patidar b Harpreet Brar 18(18) [4s-1 6s-1]
Harpreet Brar to Rajat Patidar, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!

Harpreet Brar to Kohli, byes, 1 run, misses leg stump by a whisker! Length ball sliding in with the arm, Kohli makes room and looks for a slog-sweep but misses completely. Fumble from the keeper gives them a bye
Harpreet Brar to Kohli, no run, 93.2kph, sliding in off a length from round the wicket, Kohli looks to clip it away off the back foot but is hit on the pad
Harpreet Brar [1.0-0-4-0] is back into the attack
Rabada to Rajat Patidar, no run, sharp length ball just outside off, 146kph, Patidar looks to run it to deep third but is beaten
Rabada to Rajat Patidar, no run, back of a length on off, Patidar dabs it to backward point

Rabada to Rajat Patidar, leg byes, FOUR, wrong line from Rabada and it runs away for four! Back of a length delivery straying down leg, Patidar looks to tuck it away but it goes off the thigh pad and beats short fine
Rabada to Rajat Patidar, wide, slower ball bouncer from Rabada, and it loops over Patidar's head

Rabada to Kohli, 1 run, full ball on the pads, Kohli whips it to deep midwicket and you can tell by the roar that he's reached his fifty. His approach has been very aggressive tonight, especially in that powerplay
Rabada to Kohli, 2 runs, full outside off, Kohli goes after it aggressively and slices it off the outside half over backward point. It's in the gap and he'll get back for two
Rabada to Kohli, no run, wow Kohli is in no mood to play it safe against Rabada! He backs away, gets a full ball following him and looks to slog it through midwicket. Misses it completely
Kagiso Rabada [2.0-0-12-2] is back into the attack
Timeout! 16 came off that Chahar over, giving RCB a much-needed move on. They had scored just 20 runs in the four overs before that. PBKS have gone back to Rabada now in search of a wicket.
Rahul Chahar to Rajat Patidar, no run, drifting down leg, Patidar sinks on one knee to go for the slog-sweep but is hit on the pad
Rahul Chahar to Kohli, 1 run, slightly short outside off as Chahar pulls the length back after the previous six. Kohli slaps it to sweeper cover

Rahul Chahar to Kohli, SIX, has that hit the cushions on the full? Yes it has. This is too full from Chahar, and Kohli isn't going to miss out. Tossed up outside off, he goes after it and smokes it over extra cover in that typical bottom-hand dominated manner. Smashes the cushions on the full
Rahul Chahar to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, works it off the pads through square leg for a single

Rahul Chahar to Rajat Patidar, SIX, oh just over the ropes! Patidar would've had his heart in mouth for a few moments as it went high in the air. Flat length ball on off, turns away, and he lofts it down the ground without using his feet. Gets just about enough to clear long-off

Rahul Chahar to Rajat Patidar, 2 runs, Patidar misses out on this half-tracker. It's short and turning away wide outside off, he looks to slap it straight but doesn't quite get hold of it. Long-off cuts it off
Rahul Chahar, right-arm leg break, comes into the attack
Harshal Patel to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, 136kph, fuller than a length outside off, Patidar gets forward and drives to deep point
Harshal Patel to Rajat Patidar, no run, Harshal is getting this ball to swing when he's not bowling his cutters. Good length outside off, swings away late and Patidar is beaten on the drive
Harshal Patel to Kohli, 1 run, 127kph slower short ball on off, Kohli pulls it to deep midwicket

Harshal Patel to Kohli, 2 runs, 131.6kph, back of a length delivery quite wide outside off, Kohli reaches out and cuts nicely through extrr cover. It's a chase for Livingstone in the deep and he does well
Harshal Patel to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, 126.2kph, back of a length on middle, Patidar swivels across and pulls it to deep backward square
Harshal Patel to Rajat Patidar, no run, 137.1kph, cracking yorker on middle, hint of outswing as well, and Patidar digs it out
Harshal Patel, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Harpreet Brar to Kohli, no run, 94.9kph, cut hard off the back foot and backward point makes a diving stop to his right
Harpreet Brar to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, 92.1kph, full on the stumps, tapped in front of cover for a sharp single. Dhawan fails to collect it cleanly
Harpreet Brar to Kohli, 1 run, 88.3kph, Kohli moves leg-side and Brar follows him with an in-drifter, nudged around the corner
Harpreet Brar to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, 95.4kph, in-dart, flicked to deep backward square leg
Kohli vs Harpreet Brar in the IPL (before today) Runs: 56 Balls: 45 Dismissals: 2 Avg: 28 SR: 124.44
Harpreet Brar to Rajat Patidar, leg byes, 2 runs, 87kph, the line is down leg and Patidar misses the vertical-batted sweep. Off the body and the ball rolls to fine leg
Harpreet Brar to Kohli, 1 run, 92.1kph, length ball outside off, cut to deep cover
Harpreet Brar, Left arm orthodox, comes into the attack

Powerplay summary -- Kohli makes PBKS pay after getting dropped on 0 (0.2) -- Bairstow put him down at slip off Curran -- Rabada removes both Green and Faf for 3 each -- Kohli gets dropped again on 33 (5.3)
Sam Curran to Kohli, 1 run, Kohli makes room and cheekily dabs this length ball to the right of short third man and Rabada dives across to make a superb stop. End of an eventful powerplay!
Sam Curran to Kohli, no run, full on the pads, Kohli misses out and he's livid with himself. Beats his flick and he wears it on the pad
Sam Curran to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, slower ball, Rajat Patidar opens the bat-face and guides towards short third man for a quick single

Sam Curran to Kohli, 1 run, that would have been a screamer had Chahar caught it! 129.5kph, Kohli shapes to heave across the line, doesn't keep it down and almost pays the price as it comes off the inside edge. Chahar, at midwicket, flies to his left and goes for a one-handed catch but the ball doesn't stick. A run-out chance as well but there's no direct-hit at the bowler's end and Kohli survives...
Sam Curran to Kohli, no run, 117.6kph, pace off again, Kohli waits and smashes. Hits Rajat Patidar at the non-striker's end and takes pace off the ball. A dot as it goes to mid-on
Sam Curran to Kohli, no run, 114.9kph, slower ball, Kohli looks to tap and run. The ball eludes the off-stump and goes towards the keeper who is quick to get to the ball
Sam Curran [1.0-0-16-0] is back into the attack
Rabada to Rajat Patidar, FOUR, gorgeous! 136.9kph, fuller than a length, a half-stride forward from Patidar and he plays a lovely cover drive. Exquisite timing and the placement is spot-on
Rabada to Rajat Patidar, no run, 141.5kph, back of a length on off, Patidar defends from the crease
Rajat Patidar, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Rabada to Green, out Caught by Jitesh Sharma!! Second wicket for Rabada! 137.1kph, length ball outside off, Green swings wildly across the line and gets an edge - off the toe end of the bat. Jitesh Sharma lunges forward to take a sharp, low catch. The TV umpire is summoned to check if it's a legal catch and Jitesh has done a good job, Green c Jitesh Sharma b Rabada 3(5)
Rabada to Green, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
Rabada to Kohli, leg byes, 1 run, skiddy ball, Kohli misses the pull and the ball goes towards short third man off his thigh. A needless throw at the keeper's end results in an overthrow
Rabada to Green, 1 run, 139.5kph, guided to short third man for a quick single
Rabada to Green, no run, 137.5kph, in-seamer, Green stays in his crease to defend and gets hit on the back thigh

Arshdeep Singh to Kohli, FOUR, 117.3kph, slower ball on a shortish length and Kohli deliberately opens his bat-face to guide it past the slip fielder. Short third man is inside the circle and he can only watch the ball hit the fence. Kohli has gotten RCB off to a flier!
Arshdeep Singh to Kohli, no run, 137.1kph, short ball, Kohli pulls straight to midwicket on this occasion
Arshdeep Singh to Kohli, FOUR, 134.2kph, I0$ Length ball on the stumps and Kohli whips it over midwicket to collect his seventh boundary

STAT: This was just the second instance of Faf du Plessis registering a single-digit score in 16 innings vs PBKS; the previous instance came in the 2014 Qualifier 2 at the Wankhede, wherein he was dismissed for a golden duck. Between 2019 and 2023, he had six 50-plus scores in nine innings against them.
Arshdeep Singh to Kohli, wide, 134.7kph, inswinger but Arshdeep errs with his line. Down leg and Jitesh Sharma dives to gather it
Arshdeep Singh to Kohli, no run, 136.4kph, overpitched, driven firmly to the right of mid-off where Curran makes a diving stop

Arshdeep Singh to Kohli, FOUR, 129.9kph, Kohli is dealing in boundaries. Jogs down the pitch to this short of length ball, slightly backs away to make room and flays it between mid-off and cover. Authoritative shot
Arshdeep Singh to Kohli, no run, 123.5kph, back of a length around off, Kohli taps it to backward point
Faf du Plessis vs Rabada in the IPL Innings: 3 Runs: 16 Balls: 15 Dismissals: 3 Avg: 5.33 SR: 106.67
Rabada to Green, no run, full again, Rabada gets this to shape away outside off, Green looks to mow across the line and inside-edges towards mid-on
Rabada to Green, 2 runs, 141.1kph, very full and swinging in a touch, Green clips through wide mid-on for a couple of runs
Cameron Green, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Green promoted to three! A slip in place

Rabada to du Plessis, out Caught by Sam Curran!! 137.7kph, fuller than a length on the stumps, du Plessis decides to loft it downtown. He's a bit early into his shot as the ball holds onto the pitch a bit. Balloons up off the bottom part of the bat. Curran completes a simple catch at mid-on and punches the air in delight. Even Rabada is pumped up having dismissed the RCB captain. du Plessis c Sam Curran b Rabada 3(7)
Rabada to du Plessis, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
Kohli vs Rabada in the IPL(before this game) Runs: 27 Balls: 24 Dismissals: 3 Avg: 9 SR: 112.5

Rabada to du Plessis, no run, 142.4kph, Jitesh Sharma appeals for caught behind, nothing from the bowler. Length ball seaming away with extra bounce outside off, du Plessis moves across to flay it away. Doesn't connect
Faf du Plessis moves away as Rabada comes in to bowl. Some disturbance near the sightscreen
Rabada to Kohli, 1 run, 139kph, length ball, Kohli eases it through point

Rabada to Kohli, FOUR, 134.6kph, Kohli greets Rabada with a boundary. Gives the charge to the bowler by stepping out of his crease, makes room in the process and drives on the rise. Hit over extra cover with disdain! Came right off the sweetspot. Fifth boundary for Kohli...
Kagiso Rabada, right-arm fast, comes into the attack
One slip in place

Arshdeep Singh to du Plessis, no run, 136.3kph, inswinger, du Plessis is off-balance as he looks to flick. Not sure if he got an inside edge, the ball rolls into the leg-side off his pad. Missing leg anyway
Arshdeep Singh to du Plessis, 2 runs, 136.5kph, back of a length ball, chopped through the covers for a brace

Arshdeep Singh to Kohli, leg byes, 1 run, 134.2kph, shapes in a bit, Kohli misses the flick and the ball rolls to the keeper's left off the batter's pad. Optimistic appeal for lbw, pitching outside leg and going further down
Arshdeep Singh to Kohli, wide, 134.7kph, length ball just down leg, Kohli misses the flick
Mahipal Lomror will sub in for Yash Dayal

Arshdeep Singh to du Plessis, 1 run, 131kph, fuller than a length, tapped in front of cover for a risky single. No direct-hit and du Plessis tumbles after making his crease. He's up and seems fine. A direct-hit would have been curtains for the RCB captain
Arshdeep Singh to du Plessis, no run, 133.5kph, inswinger, du Plessis pushes this length ball to mid-off
Arshdeep Singh to du Plessis, no run, 130.1kph, length ball going away with the angle, du Plessis plays inside the line to let it pass
Arshdeep Singh, left-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Sam Curran to Kohli, FOUR, 128.6kph, 16 runs off the opening over! Too full and wide of off, Kohli employs a beautiful drive to caress it through extra cover
Sam Curran to Kohli, no run, 128.4kph, short of a good length ball around off, Kohli defends
Sam Curran to Kohli, FOUR, Curran errs with his line as he strays this length ball onto the pads, Kohli glances it very fine. Hat-trick of fours for Kohli!
Sam Curran to Kohli, FOUR, 125.5kph, overpitched outside off and Kohli leans across to stylishly drive it through the covers. Lovely!

Sam Curran to Kohli, FOUR, edged and dropped! 128.3kph, fullish ball going away with the angle, Kohli drives sans any feet movement and gets a thick outside edge. A pretty straightforward catch for Bairstow who lets the ball go through his palms as he's a bit late to react. To make matters worse for Punjab, the ball runs away to third man for four
Sam Curran to Kohli, no run, 131.6kph, pitched up around off, Kohli drives hard and gets an outside edge towards short third man
Kohli and du Plessis are at the crease. Kohli is on strike. Sam Curran will open the attack
